Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This is maybe what Malbec tastes like when it's not super ripe and oaked out. Aromas of loam, crushed rocks, mushroom and elderberry. There's touches of black cherry in the dry palate, but it's the peppercorn, wild mint and graphite flavors riding the tight weave that make the magic.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Assiduous 2020 Blackridge Vineyard Malbec (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Appellation: Lake Chelan, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A fresh floral note of lilacs kicks off this wine's aromatic set, including blueberries, blackcap raspberries and honeycomb. Rich cassis and caffè mocha flavors dominate the palate, with a slightly bitter orange pith note on the long finish. Beautiful acidity with silky tannins.                      Michael Alberty
Name: Kludt Family 2019 Lot 2 Reserve Malbec (Lake Chelan)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: 88% Malbec, with 6% each of Cabernet Sauvignon and Petit Verdot, this graceful blend shows off blackberry, honeysuckle, sage and cardamom aromas. A distinct black-cherry flavor is flanked by notes of orange peel, and a dark-chocolate croissant. Silky tannins, with elevated acidity and a slick, smooth texture.                      Michael Alberty
Name: Board Track Racer 2020 Malbec (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aged in French and American oak, this 100% Malbec shows aromas of blackcap raspberries, pipe tobacco, wet slate and vanillin. The tannins are sturdy, and the mouthfeel is leathery, with flavors like black cherries, black tea and thyme. Meet my new "go-to" wine for Barbacoa tacos.                      Michael Alberty
Name: Fidelitas 2019 Quintessence Vineyard Malbec (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dark wood aromas of mahogany met with dark plum and light cocoa on the nose of this bottling. The palate is dense with roasted plum and elderberry flavors, showing a pleasant grape-y note on the finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Rancho Sisquoc 2020 Malbec (Santa Barbara County)

Description: This Malbec has a good balance of fruit and herbs with a delicate structure. The nose displays notes of berries and aromatic herbs that repeat on the palate. A smooth texture and lively acidity hold raspberry, blackberry and blueberry flavors with hints of smoke. It has an elegant finish with subtle notes of chocolate. Drink now–2029.                      Jesica Vargas
Name: Bodega Catena Zapata 2019 Argentino Malbec (Argentina)Cellar Selection
